channel.title: Reeves & Jost Labs
channel.description: Recent content on Reeves & Jost Labs

item.title: Welcome
item.description:
Hello and welcome to the new home for the Reeves Lab!

The goal here is to highlight the work that we here are doing so that we can reach a broad audience with our research into natural killer cells and HIV/SIV!

item.title: CMV Primes Functional Alternative Signaling in Adaptive Î”g NK Cells but Is Subverted by Lentivirus Infection in Rhesus Macaques
Indirect activation of rhesus macaque (Macaca mulatta) NK cells in oral and mucosal draining lymph nodes.
Progressive lentivirus infection induces natural killer cell receptor-expressing B cells in the gastrointestinal tract

item.description:
Soon-to be masters student of bioinformatics at the University of Maryland University College. Research interests include: transcriptomic profiling of memory-like NK cells, transcriptomic modulation during viral infection, and automated analyses of flow cytometry data.

Outside of the lab I enjoy competitive strength sports, hiking, and cycling around the Fells.
